applications.title: Nanny Now
applications.body: Nanny Now is an application that aims to connect parents with qualified childcare. Upon signing up or logging in, user authentication will then give the user access and ability to search for nannies. Current available cities are Chicago and Denver. Used Express.js to build our RESTful APis as well as to connect to mySQL database using sequelize. Application is hosted on Heroku with a database.
applications.technologies: JavaScript, Bootstrap, Express/Express-Session, Node, Nodemailer, Handlebars, Sequelize, mySQL, APIs

applications.title: Fridge Foodie
applications.body: For food lovers or those less confident in the kitchen, Fridge Foodie allows a user search recipes based off 3 ingredients they've entered as well as any dietary restriction selected. Based on the given parameters, it makes a call to Edamam and Spoonacular, two client side APIs to display food and drink pairings matching the input.

applications.title: Tech Blog
applications.body: Utilizes the MVC architectural structure for the front and backend build out of a tech blog site where a user can create a post, update or delete their post, and also comment on other users posts. Hosted on Heroku with a database and uses user authentication and as well as cookies.
applications.technologies: JavaScript, Bootstrap, Express/Express-Session,Node, Handlebars, Sequelize, mySQL,APIs

applications.title: Team Generator
applications.body: This CLI application dynamically generates an HTML file displaying team members based off user input using the inquirer NPM package.
applications.technologies: JavaScript, Inquirer, Jest, Node, TDD, Bootstrap
